Manager.description: Now that I know how to do this correctly, it's got to be done. Right now, if the screen is flipped during a network operation in a background thread, two background threads get spawned, and the network operation is done twice. Fortunately for this app, our network threads are all non-destructive GETs, but it's still wrong. In addition, it means the post-execute handler of a thread gets called twice, and in the case of loading a legislator, this means that startActivity() gets called twice on LegislatorTabs, meaning that the user has to hit back twice (through a clone of the activity) to get out -- and if the user has window loading animations enabled, they'll visually see the LegislatorTabs activity zoom in (or whatever) twice.
Manager.title: Handle background tasks and dialogs properly on screen flip

Manager.description: When the app is loaded, be it List, Profile, or Main Menu, have it check for the CSV, and download it. Make a SunlightDownloader activity that does this. The downloader will download the file to a temporary filename, load the info into the database, and then rename the file to a steady filename. This steady filename will be what gets checked for age, and its presence can be used to verify that the DB is fully loaded. If the file is there and less than 30 days old, don't call out to the SunlightDownloader activity. This check needs to be present in all possible entry points to the app (CreateShortcut, LegislatorLoader, MainMenu). If the file is there, but 30 or more days older, the CSV will be downloaded. Failure to download means the app goes on. If the file isn't there, the CSV must be downloaded. Failure to download means the app shuts down. Effects on the app: State and last name should look in the database. Profile loading should use the database. Remove any now-needless offline checks, like the automatic shutdown from LegislatorLoader. Shutdown checks will happen if the SunlightDownloader fails when it must not fail. Everything else should work exactly the same - the point here is for this feature to look invisible.
Manager.title: Work Offline - download Sunlight's CSV

Manager.description: We want to decouple the basic logic and properties of Bill, Legislator, and Roll, from the network functions required to load them. Move the methods that do network calls into the LegislatorService, BillService, and RollService interfaces. Implement those interfaces as CongressLegislatorService, CongressBillService, and CongressRollService. Store them as a public static member variable on Legislator, Bill, and Roll, so that methods can be called using "Legislator.service.allWhere(...)", "Bill.service.find(...)", etc. The Congress____Service classes should be in their own package, and this is also where the Drumbone and Sunlight classes can go.
Manager.title: Decouple Legislator, Bill, and Roll

Manager.description: Allow the user to "star" legislators and bills by putting an empty star in the top left of the title bar, where the app icon is now. By tapping it, this legislator or bill will show up at the top of the main menu for quick access, and in the case of legislators, it will show those legislators at the top of the roll call list on RollInfo. Store enough information for each row in the database that we can use the direct-load approach to getting to the LegislatorTabs or BillTabs activities (see Utils for what information is required). This will mean two SQLite tables, one for starred bills, and one for starred legislators. For now, let's call them just "legislators" and "bills", instead of "starred_legislators", as we may add more flags and information later on (specifically, for the option of notifications per-bill and per-legislator).

Manager.description: Use this Signpost library for the OAuth stuff, it's made for this: http://code.google.com/p/oauth-signpost/ http://brainflush.wordpress.com/2009/05/03/introducing-signpost-easy-oauth-for-java-and-apache-httpcomponents-android-too/ This will also let us use the "source" field on updates, which is sweet. We can still use the username/password collection UI-wise, we can use xAuth: http://groups.google.com/group/twitter-development-talk/browse_thread/thread/c2c4963061422f28 http://the.hackerconundrum.com/2010/02/sneak-peek-at-twitters-browserless.html You'll have to email the api address for Twitter to get access to that, though. This means we can stop storing the username/password on the phone, and just (invisibly) store the OAuth token/secret. We can remove the Twitter settings dialog entirely.
Manager.title: Switch to using Twitter with OAuth/xAuth

Manager.description: In between "New Laws" and "Just Introduced", add a "Latest Votes" item, that links to the BillList activity. The BillList should populate itself from Drumbone by asking for bills sorted on last_vote_at, in descending order, and filter 'session' on the current session of Congress. Don't worry about filtering on any other flags, it's okay to depend on last_vote_at to filter out bills with no votes, as long as it's in descending order (which is the default). Each list item should look like it does for New Laws and Just Introduced, except the introductory line should say whether the bill passed or failed, and in which chamber. For example: "S. 5176 passed the Senate:" "H. Res. 675 failed in the House:" Passage or failure should be dictated by the contents of the "result" field of the most recent vote in the "votes" section. You should be able to follow the example of how the other two calls to Drumbone work, but for reference, the documentation for Drumbone is here: http://services.sunlightlabs.com/docs/Drumbone_API/
Manager.title: "Latest Votes" menu item and bill list

Manager.description: This could be inline, or as a tab, I don't know yet. But we need to show passage votes on a bill, as well as a way to see all procedural votes on a bill, with a link to a roll call screen for all of them where applicable. Obviously, some passage votes are going to be voice votes, and we have to indicate that clearly.
Manager.title: Show passage votes on a bill

Manager.description: On the bill list, if a bill's relevant date is from a prior year, include the year at the end of the date to disambiguate it. So March 23, 2010 would be "Mar 23" December 5, 2009 would be "Dec 5, 2009"
Manager.title: Dates of bills on BillList should include years for older years

Manager.description: It's okay to have a "Load more..." item at the bottom of the list, which when clicked loads in more. Don't worry about having it auto-fetch when you near the bottom of the list, like the Market does.
Manager.title: Basic pagination for bill lists

Manager.description: That's different from the ones for Introduced Bills and Latest Laws.
Manager.title: Icon for Latest Votes

Manager.description: Once #163 is done, add a tab for the votes section of a bill, with the details of each vote.
Manager.title: Show votes on a bill in a tab

Manager.description: For smaller tabs, perhaps icon-less.
Manager.title: Custom tab icons

Manager.description: Beneath "Latest Votes", an option to find by typing in a bill code. Strip caps, spaces, periods.
Manager.title: Find bills by bill code

Manager.description: With the impending addition of Favorites, and more ways to find bills, there's going to be way too much the user might want to do off of the main menu. Some sort of light dashboard, Twitter-app style, would be nice, though there's not as much for the user to do in our app. Easy access to: Bill searches Legislator searches Favorites Update my location Settings
Manager.title: Redesign main menu screen

Manager.description: Maybe this is the actions list, but it should probably be separate, showing all procedural votes. And yet, we also want this to be separate from passage votes, which may or may not be roll calls. Some trickiness to laying this out.
Manager.title: Show all procedural roll calls on a bill

Manager.description: In line with the new 2.0+ icon design standards, for a front-facing icon, instead of one at an isometric angle.
Manager.title: New app icon

Manager.description: A publisher can upload a larger, differently proportioned image, so that the app can be featured in other ways. The time has come.
Manager.title: New promotional graphic

Manager.description: The latest votes a legislator has made, a list of roll calls with their vote called out. Whether this is a tappable item like sponsored bills, or a tab of its own, I don't really care.
Manager.title: Show legislator's latest votes

Manager.description: I'm unable to generate them, they may have been broken in the last update without me noticing. Verify, and fix.
Manager.title: Legislator shortcuts may be broken

Manager.description: Rep. Joseph Sestak Jr. has apparently no news results, even though he's in an extremely frequently discussed Pennsylvania Senate race. See if we can't improve the search term formation algorithm.
Manager.title: Improve news name search

Manager.description: Of things like "H. J. Res", etc. Don't write anything original, just take it from the Senate glossary (and attribute it as such).
Manager.title: Add a glossary

Manager.description: If a page of bills fails to load, there's no indication to the user that it failed, it'll just read "Loading..." forever. Make it so that a failed bill load, such as in the case of lost reception, a Retry button appears so that the bills can be requested once a network connection is restored.
Manager.title: Retry button for pagination

Manager.description: How tricky would this be to do on Android? Do we need to set up another service, or is something out there already?
Manager.title: Showing map of an outline of a legislator's district

Manager.description: Check whether the /assets directory, which is there just for the source repository, is actually getting packaged into the APK and needlessly inflating file size.
Manager.title: Are the SVG files being compiled into the APK?

Manager.description: Al Franken's medium image has no white border: http://assets.sunlightfoundation.com/moc/100x125/F000457.jpg His large image does: http://assets.sunlightfoundation.com/moc/200x250/F000457.jpg When you first ask for his image on the list, for the medium image, it has no border. Loading his profile loads the large image, with a border. Future requests for his medium image (sponsorship, listing) loads the large one, with a border. Why?
Manager.title: Large image getting selected when medium is asked for

Manager.description: For Android 2.2.
Manager.title: Add permission to allow moving to the SD card

Manager.description: After the summary is done loading, spin off a LoadLegislatorTask to get a sponsor object in place. When the user taps the sponsor, if the legislator is loaded, use it for a quick transfer to LegislatorTabs. Otherwise, keep the longer path to LegislatorLoader.
Manager.title: Load in legislator silently on BillInfo for quick transfer

Manager.description: The Android team recommends caching child views on list item views, so that if you use the recycled view, you don't have to call findViewById each time. Let's do this on each of our list adapters that uses the recycled view pattern, and that's long enough for it to matter.
Manager.title: Use ViewHolder pattern on the big list adapters

Manager.description: Store the code in the shortcut intent, and pass it into the bill intent that it stores.
Manager.title: Add bill code and title bar to BillLoader

Manager.description: Once the main menu scales better, split out the Just Introduced and Latest Votes sections into Resolution-specific and Bill-specific stuff. Drumbone will have to support asking for particular types of bills.
Manager.title: Split out bills and resolutions

Manager.description: Leave the "Create Shortcut" menu options in, but remove the ability to add a Shortcut through the home screen Add->Shortcut menu. The code it requires won't be worth the trouble once people can favorite legislators.
Manager.title: Remove shortcut generation through home screen path

Manager.description: Not just roll calls tied to bill passage votes. This falls into two categories: Votes related to bills, that aren't passage votes. Everything else. Speaker elections, nominations, treaties, whatever. For #1, you have to show the bill on a roll call vote and link to it, but expect that the question and result aren't tied to passage. Maybe this doesn't mean much to the UI, but think about it. For #2, you have to support the one-time-only case where the vote types aren't aye/nay/NV/present. I'd prefer to anticipate this in Roll and do most of the hard logic there, and to have RollInfo easily see when alternate vote types are present and display them appropriately.
Manager.title: See and support all roll calls

Manager.description: As recommended in my Google I/O notes from the ListView talk, give the getViewTypeCount, areAllItemsEnabled, etc. helper methods for each applicable ListView.
Manager.title: Define all the helper methods for lists

Manager.description: I believe my Google I/O notes included inflating views with a ViewRoot, and setting attachToRoot to false.
Manager.title: Inflate views using three-argument form where possible

Manager.description: And add a Donate menu option in the app that brings the user to that app in the Market.
Manager.title: Add Donate shell app to the Market

Manager.description: Show the details of a roll call, and the votes of every legislator involved.
Manager.title: Roll call page

Manager.description: To speed up scrolling through LegislatorList, and stop all the disk reads.
Manager.title: Hold a hash of bioguide_ids to Drawables in LegislatorList

Manager.description: If a roll call is associated with a particular bill, we want to show a couple of basic details about the bill (the code, the title) in a tappable list item, similar to how we show the sponsor of a bill on the bill detail page. This information is available in the "bill" section of a roll call, in Drumbone. You can also tell from the "bill_id" field in the "basic" section whether that section will be present. The bill section has enough data that I'd prefer not to fetch it if we don't have to. However, we don't want to load the bill data asynchronously, it should be fetched along with the basic information of a bill. So, I think we should send in a flag in the Intent for RollInfo that says whether or not the "bill" section should be fetched, since we're always going to be getting to the RollInfo screen from a place that knows whether a bill is attached or not. Even if we create a RollList activity in the future, we'll have the bill_id at that time and will know whether to send in that flag to RollInfo.
Manager.title: Add list item and link to bill for roll calls related to bills

Manager.description: I have a suspicion that AsyncTasks are operating even after I hit the back button out of a screen. Figure out if this is true, and if so, finish.
Manager.title: Make sure to cancel AsyncTasks on activity finish

Manager.description: Vote listings can link to out of office legislators, like Eric Massa. Either handle out of office legislators, and display that they're out of office, etc., or show a message that's better than saying there's a connection error, which is incorrect.
Manager.title: Handle out of office legislators

Manager.description: In other words, stop casting to LinearLayout when all you want to do is findViewById - you can do that on a regular view, and it makes your code susceptible to unexpected crashes if you change how you structure a piece of layout.
Manager.title: Get rid of casting to specific ViewGroups where possible

Manager.description: Which means, do reflection somehow and send in default tabs for older devices.
Manager.title: Fix custom tabs for 1.5 devices

Manager.description: The location header doesn't fit in 1.5.
Manager.title: Fix LegislatorList location header on 1.5

Manager.description: Show more interesting vote breakdowns (like by party), and just take an axe to the whole thing and redesign it.
Manager.title: Redo vote page entirely

Manager.description: Now that I actually know how to do this sort of thing, let's load up the YouTube thumbnails and show them on the left of the list item.
Manager.title: YouTube thumbnails

Manager.description: Try it out on the righthand side of the title bar, for instance.
Manager.title: More prominent Share for bills

Manager.description: Let's try an approach like the call log in the Contacts app - where we shorten the Sponsor item horizontally, and make room on the right for a box that says "View 96 Cosponsors", that when tapped opens up LegislatorList with the cosponsors of a bill.
Manager.title: Cosponsors information

Manager.description: See if we can aggregate actions that happen on the same day, so that date headers get repeated only when it changes. One approach: When the actions are first loaded from the network, iterate through them once and store the indexes of the first view for which you see a new date. As the adapter for displaying the dates loads views, have it hide the data for any action item whose index wasn't kept. Style the date and action items differently to take advantage of how this looks.
Manager.title: Eliminate redundant dates on History tab for bill

Manager.description: Make an icon with a glow effect that will be the pressed state for the app icon.
Manager.title: Make the app icon in the title bar return the user home

Manager.description: Whoops.
Manager.title: Switch "Aye" to "Yea" everywhere

Manager.description: A tab, or possibly a link to a list, like Sponsored Bills. But either way, show the user the legislator's most recent votes on any roll call - and have that roll call list item link to the full screen.
Manager.title: Votes for Legislators

Manager.description: A user, Dave with a Nexus One, reports this: Yes, I have both [location providers] enabled on my phone, most apps work fine. Your app said something about not being able to figure out my location. Then I went to Google maps to make sure my location was correctly determined, then I went back to your app, but it just says unable to determine location. FYI, I rebooted my phone and it searched again, and said "My location, cannot update location". I don't know why this would be. (Yelp, Google Maps, Zillow, etc all work fine)
Manager.title: Location bug report

Manager.description: We have some missing legislators, do a sweep.
Manager.title: Update legislator photos

Manager.description: If the GPS lookup is hanging, like if the user is inside of a building, closing the app won't stop the lookup, which can drain battery until the user shuts off GPS entirely. Hopefully, we can place something in MainMenu's and LegislatorList's onPause callbacks to halt the GPS lookup.
Manager.title: Stop GPS lookup when the app is paused or closed

Manager.description: A number of people have requested committee search from the main menu, in addition to the per-legislator option we have right now. Add an option on the Main Menu to find legislators by Committee. When tapped, this will open a new "CommitteeTabs" activity with three tabs, one for "House", "Senate", and "Joint". Each tab will list the committees for that chamber. Each tab can be an instance of a new "CommitteeList" activity, that takes a different "chamber" parameter. Each instance of CommitteeList will be backed by one network call to the Sunlight Congress API. Each committee, when tapped, will direct to the existing LegislatorList form for a committee search. Expand CommitteeService to have a new method that gets all committees. You can use this page for documentation of the Sunlight Congress API endpoint that supplies this: http://services.sunlightlabs.com/docs/congressapi/committees.getList/ Try to follow the code patterns set in existing tab activities and network backed lists.
Manager.title: Committee list page accessible from main menu

Manager.description: It's painful to have people figure out the base URL if they're gonna work with the app, and it's inconsistent with the Sunlight class.
Manager.title: Move drumbone base URL into the code

Manager.description: Why leave it as loading?
Manager.title: On LegislatorList, use no_photo_female instead of leaving it as loading

Manager.description: Add SpeakerPelosi for Pelosi Remove SenArlenSpecter for Specter Use http://twitter.com/SpeakerPelosi/status/15949926907 for possible others Remove Barbara_Boxer for Barbara Boxer Sweep Google for others
Manager.title: Update Twitter accounts again

Manager.description: The summary header is compressed oddly.
Manager.title: Display bug on 1.5 on RollInfo

Manager.description: Revert the changes to header_alone_2 that forced top alignment for the textviews. Remove the tab reflection code. Simplify the shortcut image generation code. Remove the unneeded tab asset drawables. Stop using Build.VERSION.SDK and start using Build.VERSION.SDK_INT Re-add layout_centerVertical to footer text and image Remove duplicate images in /res/drawable and profile_picture.xml from /res/layout Check to see if we can ditch LegislatorLoader and BillLoader in favor of having each task that needs a Legislator or Bill loaded use a common task (the bizarre trackball bug must have been fixed)
Manager.title: On the day we can drop 1.5 support

Manager.description: Specify all_legislators=true on the call in LegislatorService.
Manager.title: Handling out of office legislators

Manager.description: It just spins forever. Example (as of right now): Scott Brown has sponsored no bills.
Manager.title: Sponsored Bills screen doesn't say when there are none

Manager.description: There are many
Manager.title: Remove bad official legislator website URLs

Manager.description: To explain why it's not email, but a contact form.
Manager.title: First time popup on contact button

Manager.description: It might be nice to see news mentions on bills, either by code or by short or popular title, if there is one. Investigate how frequently there are results, with an eye more towards bills in the Latest Laws and Recent Votes sections.
Manager.title: Look into news mentions for bills

Manager.description: Not sure who klondike is but he sure has some ideas LOL here's my list: Search (name, location, full text, related,) filter (state, local, federal, relevance, importance (do we really wanna see all the building 'naming' bills?) obviously add state and local laws. Email for every official! who voted for what and when link on bill to other bills sponsored by official Share option (BT, email, maybe a bump extension?) Link to PDF of full text Voting histories with links to bills Public contributions accepted and related legislation (based on text search of contributors) There is so much to do with this app... it could be one of the most influential tools come November... it could change the direction of the entire country. Of course you'd have to dummy proof it (hide most of it in advanced settings) and make a big red button that says CURRENTLY UNDER VOTE for things like health care and unemployment, medicare, social security etc... It would be THE goto place for all the armchair non-voters and get them off their asses to vote. I kid you not. P.S. trust me on this one... put out a 'donations' button on your next update and you'll see what i'm talking about! Yes I know it's open source but this is the only place to leave a comment, pass it on.
Manager.title: Features that I'd pay for

Manager.description: The ability is now lost entirely, figure out some solution.
Manager.title: Make links clickable on tweets again

Manager.description: To be more stable, and more clear, even at the cost of duplicated code across a couple of activities.
Manager.title: Refactor location code

Manager.description: When BillTabs or LegislatorTabs are opened, and the legislator is already favorited, update the database with the latest information, so that if the title of a bill changes, or a legislator changes parties or something, the favorites database gets updated and the main menu remains fresh.
Manager.title: Keep favorited legislators and bills fresh

Manager.description: Not just the info/profile page.
Manager.title: Extend menus onto all leg and bill tabs

Manager.description: Now that we're handling out-of-office legislators, we have to include a way to notice that.
Manager.title: Visually denote when a legislator is out-of-office

Manager.description: They should appear first.
Manager.title: Put starred legislators at the top of the roll call list

Manager.description: A four-tabbed approach, then - Yeas, Nays, NV, Present. Potential to put the vote count on the tabs, instead of breaking them above.
Manager.title: Split roll call votes into yeas and nays

Manager.description: For writing to a legislator.
Manager.title: Add contact button

Manager.description: This means a number of things: Notifications about a bill you've starred (new actions, votes). Notifications about a legislator you've starred (new tweets, videos). Notifications about new laws. Notifications should be enable-able/disable-able in their entirety from the main menu, using a footer that doesn't scroll with the rest of the menu. Notifications for a particular bill or legislator should be enable-able/disable-able from a footer on the bottom of LegislatorTabs, that will be visible from all tabs. There should be a preferences activity that lets the user enable/disable notifications, and also set their interval. This interval should apply to all notifications. Notification subscriptions should be stored in a separate table from favorites, so that we can keep them decoupled.
Manager.title: Notifications

Manager.description: Somewhere.
Manager.title: Display office location and room number

Manager.description: Two problems should be fixed: User taps a bill name, is brought to BillLoader, user hits back, a few seconds later they are taken to the bill anyway. User taps a vote name in the Votes tab for a bill, immediately hits back, a Force Close error appears.
Manager.title: Cancel all AsyncTasks in onDestroy

Manager.title: Make a fifth "All" tab on RollInfo

Manager.description: The votes tab for a bill should have the ability to show all votes, including procedural votes (such as cloture votes). This won't include procedural voice votes, but it should still be there. On the Votes tab, have two radio buttons beneath the title bar, On Passage and All, and have it default to On Passage. On Passage will, for now, use the passage_votes object on Bill. Later, it can use the votes endpoint that we'll augment with a type of "passage", "cloture", or "other" (at least). All will load up all the votes with a separate call to the votes endpoint, using the bill_id.
Manager.title: Link to all procedural roll calls for a bill

Manager.title: Add a way to deploy arbitrary notifications with a link

Manager.description: Two reasons: If a user goes and visits a list they're subscribed to on their own, and sees the latest stuff, there's no reason to notify them of new things. If we update the lastSeenId when we notify, there's no way to accumulate unread items. Thus, if there's one new item, and the user doesn't tap it, then there's another new item, this will overwrite the existing notification and say "1 new item" when in fact there are two. A complication: we do not want the notification to keep going off if the number of unread items doesn't change, even if the user hasn't visited the screen with the new items yet. So we would have to keep track that we have notified the user of a particular number (probably in a separate, smaller SQL table), and then only re-notify the user if the number changes/increases. Makes it more tempting to simply remove the number from the notifications altogether!
Manager.title: Updating what's been seen on visiting the results, or remove numbers

Manager.description: We mention specifically the "network" and "gps" providers in a few places. When finding the lastKnownLocation, we use the network and GPS provider constants. We can instead use getProviders(Criteria criteria, boolean enabledOnly) and cycle the resultant list, first with a fine criteria and then a coarse criteria. When actually requesting the location to be found, we first try the GPS and then we try the network provider. Instead, we should first try a fine provider and then try a coarse provider if that one times out. If no fine provider exists, we use a coarse provider, and fail upon timeout. (In the onTimeout method, instead of checking whether the provider's string matches the GPS or NETWORK constants, we should find the LocationProvider by that string, and check its accuracy level.) This may actually not be much work.
Manager.title: Be agnostic to individual location providers

Manager.description: Sigh, it's shutting down: http://developer.yahoo.com/blogs/ydn/posts/2010/08/api_updates_and_changes/ Leading contender for replacement is the Google News API: http://code.google.com/apis/newssearch/v1/jsondevguide.html I'd need to include the words "powered by Google" on the list though. Other contender is the Bing News API: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd250884.aspx Example JSON: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd250908.aspx Problem with this one is the potential advertising content and restrictions on dealing with them: http://www.bing.com/developers/tou.aspx "We may include our trademark(s) or logo(s) in Bing results provided through the services and, if we do so, you will not remove, modify, or interfere with the display or viewing of these trademarks or logos. Whether we include trademarks or logos or not, you will attribute us as the source of the Bing results (in the manner that we may specify from time to time in applicable services documentation) and display the "attribution" data field (if a non-blank field is returned as part of the Bing results). In any display of trademarks, logos, or attribution, you will comply with the current version of our usage guidelines (which are currently located at http://www.microsoft.com/about/legal/intellectualproperty/trademarks/usage/general.mspx and http://www.bing.com/toolbox/posts/archive/2009/10/15/bing-product-guidelines-and-brand-assets.aspx). We may also include advertising in Bing results provided through the services and, if we do so, you will not remove, modify, or interfere with the display or viewing of this advertising. On any page in which you display Bing results, you will only display advertising that we serve or provide."
Manager.title: Replace Yahoo News API

I think there's already an alert function in Utils, we just need to make sure it gets called. * It turns out this is because I hadn't put in a Google News API key. Manager.description: This is getting stored in data, not cache, so I'm not sure what to do. We could store a timestamp of when it got seen and wait X months before flushing. But I'm worried about storing dates in SQLite, honestly, after my failed attempt to migrate the bills table. Maybe upon each update of the table, we could flush out the oldest X entries for that subscription type, where X is some multiple of the number of entries fetched by the subscriber. So for bills, where it fetches 40, we could have it flush anything besides the most recent 80 or 120 entries. Age could be determined by ordering on the autoincrementing _id, instead of making a new timestamp field. This can be decided in a future update.
Manager.title: Implement some sort of flushing routine for notification tables

Manager.description: I want this self contained in the Footer somehow, or at least not something that adds a footprint to every Activity that uses one. Saving state across screen flips so that an AsyncTask could still update the UI after completion would necessitate writing code in the Activity, as far as I can see. So, have the footer instantly go on or off visually, and then either: Spawn the database operation off into an AsyncTask where the completion callback doesn't interact with the UI at all. Unsure how robust this is, but I think it would work. AsyncTasks don't get killed when an activity exits, under normal conditions anyway. Run an IntentService that does the work. More theoretically robust, but involves a new class or two, and passing subscription information via intents, etc. I'm more a fan of number 1 for now. Both mean that if the save operation fails for some reason, the only recourse is a toast alert that would contradict the successful visual feedback that the user just saw. I think it's worth it for the speed; I got two or three ANRs just messing around, earlier, on my Nexus One.
Manager.title: Move the subscription database access off the UI thread

Manager.description: Though I can't think of an immediate practical case, it could certainly happen. Right now the check to see if one has a subscription is whether or not any entries have been made. One gets made for each item in the list. The best way to do it might be to always create one new entry for a subscription, with a null "seen_id" field. It'll get cleared along with the rest, will not trigger as an instance of anything being seen that hasn't, and should work.
Manager.title: Allow subscribing to empty lists

Manager.description: Besides the aid in debugging odd seeming things, it'd be a nice UX feature. The NotificationService would have to package the array of strings of new IDs into a consistent extra on any Intent it packs into the notification. Each activity would be responsible for storing the new IDs, or passing them into the constructor for the list adapter, so that the list adapter knows to highlight or otherwise mark each list item. The best way is to probably just alter the background color of new items with a consistent shade, stored in colors.xml. Having to add code to each list of which one can be notified is annoying, but maybe only necessary for long lists like BillList, RollList, and LegislatorList (if we get cosponsor notifications running).
Manager.title: Highlight new items when coming in from a notification

Manager.description: Basically, on migration: Add a method Database.removeSubscription(subscription, true) which is like removeSubscription(subscription), but only removes rows where seen_id is null for each seen_id-less subscription -- Database.getSubscriptions() remove just the seen_id-less rows -- Database.removeSubscription(subscription, true) add 1 seen_id-less row back for it -- Database.addSubscription(subscription) This is only needed to a fix a bug where the notification checker has been filling up people's database with useless seen_id-less rows for their subscriptions. Besides being needed for a new feature, this will also lessen the data footprint the app takes up on people's phones.
Manager.title: On migration, fix duplicate subscription rows

Manager.description: This article is making some compelling points: http://android-developers.blogspot.com/2011/09/androids-http-clients.html I think we could make the underlying fetch mechanism conditional on the platform version code and abstract it out into some utils functions. Manager.description: It would take care of: Defining a "Date" subitem, and require the subclass to define a method to map items to their date. It would take care of inserting the date wherever it changed. It would inflate the date view and insert the date into it. Subclasses could optionally override the dateformat or even the whole inflation. Optionally accept an array of IDs to highlight, as long as the subclass has overridden the method to map an item to its ID. It would take the getView method that the subclass implements and insert it into a frame inside of a bigger view, with room for a highlight effect (depending on how the highlight effect should be implemented). In future, we could implement the "sticky header" effect on dates, or whatever, all through this adapter. This would seem to be applicable both to activities and fragments, and wouldn't require full fragmentization of Roll-, Bill-, and LegislatorList.
Manager.title: Unify date presentation with a common list adapter

Manager.description: Tentative idea: tapping on star brings down a pane of checkboxes of things to subscribe to. Pane can be dismissed, and subscribing to anything yellows the star. Tapping the star brings down the same pane, to edit the selection. Unhandled: How does someone follow a person or bill without needing notifications enabled? (i.e. shortcut menu) Possibly this can be ignored, and the concept of subscription-less favorites scrapped. How do we handle when someone has notifications disabled? Is this a way to guide someone into enabling them? How should this look? How do we not be obnoxious to people who don't have notifications enabled? Possibly: the pane without notifications enabled displays copy and a button to take you to the notification settings screen, or simply turns on notifications in-place.

Manager.description: There's a set of things to be done to ready the app for the Kindle Fire. If this is pursued, these might be broken out into separate tickets. Look at any low-hanging-fruit design choices you can make to optimize for "large" type screens. Mark location as optional in the manifest, and explicitly check for this feature when generating LegislatorList. Remove the item to search by location. Double check for the feature right before the actual location call gets made. Mark telephony as optional in the manifest, and explicitly check for this feature when generating LegislatorProfile. Remove the call option. The Kindle Fire comes with an email client, and Amazon says it responds to email intents, but I witnessed a crash when I tried it. Figure out how to generalize it to work on any Android device. Remove the district map button if Google Services (the Maps app) are not installed. Make sure the "Share" intent for bills still works as advertised.
Manager.title: Kindle Fire

Manager.description: It's inevitable that if a bill is noticed as happening in two separate sources, it appears twice in the web service. This method is where we'll centralize all aggregation and display logic.

Manager.description: This is really more of an RTC issue, but to keep the work together - "sopa" should find the Stop Online Piracy Act, and it should be the top result. To do this, create two fields on bills/bill_versions, and make them searchable, "nicknames", and "possible_nicknames". Start automatically calculating possible acronyms upon index, and adding them to the "possible_nicknames" field as an array. Create a CSV, by hand, with known acronyms, publish them on Github somewhere, and start wiring these acronyms into the "acronyms" field on index, by wgetting the file from Github directly. This will work for a long, long time, and is not a load on Github (twice a day, tiny file). Starting examples: "sopa" => SOPA, "pipa" => PIPA, "obamacare" => [PPACA, Reconciliation] Boost the "nicknames" field so that it gets a ton of precedence in scoring. Make it publicly known that we're keeping this file, and welcome contributions from OC, GovTrack, others.
Manager.title: Acronyms should find bills

Manager.description:
@konklone discusses publishing to F-Droid in this discussion thread: In order to support F-Droid, I will need to:
* make it so if analytics is disabled through a configuration flag, this also activates graceful handling of the Google Analytics JAR being missing entirely. * also, if analytics is disabled, do not include a menu option that goes to the Settings activity in the main screen. * write a build script that does this work as part of the fdroid build process - and in general, automate as much of [the manual](https://f-droid.org/manual/) as possible. I haven't yet firmly decided to do this - it is a non-trivial amount of work. However, if it is done, it'll be done in a manner that doesn't require maintaining a separate branch. Other requirements: Deal with an API key that I don't want to commit to source control Other values in keys.xml, like our contact email, debug flags, etc.
Manager.title: Support F-Droid

Manager.description: BillLoader and LegislatorLoader were originally added because back in the day when I was using TabActivity, there was an absurd bug where if you loaded the TabActivity without any tabs added, it would crash when not in touch mode (when in trackball mode). Now that we're using an Activity that loads ViewPager'd fragments, this isn't a problem, so we should be able to move the background network fetching into the Activities with the ViewPager themselves. This would also have to address the path that notifications to bill and legislator info take when tapped.

Manager.description: I'm shipping a pretty crude map today. It could use a lot of help going forward. Here are some things to remember: the Mapbox Android SDK may add better native support for GeoJSON - https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-android-sdk/issues/331 is good but https://github.com/mapbox/mapbox-android-sdk/issues/330 is needed too. Alaska is way too zoomed out, despite some optimizations just for its special nature zooming is crazy and impossible scrolling is a bit jerky, when it works at all, and can conflict with swiping from tab to tab the shape needs shading, and the line needs to be more attractive it'd be nice to cache the map tiles so they don't need to be re-downloaded (shouldn't this be happening already?)
Manager.title: Map improvements

Manager.description: This is used to parse GeoJSON for district maps. The normal JSON parser is obviously fine, but the GeoJSON object mapper requires Jackson. 2.2 isn't a very large % of our users, just a few %. But instead of ditching Android 2.2 just yet, I'm inclined to just disable maps for Android 2.2, with a message. It is still an improvement on the broken, ugly situation they were in previously, and the alternative is to do my own native GeoJSON parsing, or to drop 2.2 altogether.
Manager.title: Jackson parser doesn't work in Android 2.2

Manager.description: The Reset the Net campaign makes some great points in this post about securing mobile apps: http://resetthenet.tumblr.com/post/84327981750/how-we-secure-our-phones-ssl-cert-pinning-pfs Basically, that cert pinning is an excellent and practical way to opt out of trusting the CA system on mobile phones. They link to a detailed guide of how to do this on many systems, including Android. Cert pinning for third party services, like Google Analytics, is maybe more tricky, but also very worthwhile.
Manager.title: Add certificate pinning
